content.question:
The binding of erythropoietin to the erythropoietin receptor (<math alttext="E P o R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EPoR</mi></math>) stimulates intracellular signaling in certain cells, which causes them to differentiate to red blood cells. The <math alttext="E P o R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EPoR</mi></math> is a transmembrane protein with two cytoplasmic domains, each of which is bound by a kinase protein, <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math>. The binding of erythropoietin to the <math alttext="E P o R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EPoR</mi></math> causes the cytoplasmic domains of the <math alttext="E P o R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EPoR</mi></math> to undergo conformational changes that activate the bound <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math> kinases. The <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math> kinases then phosphorylate several intracellular proteins, including <math alttext="S T A T 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>STAT</mi><mn>5</mn></math>, whose resulting activity causes the cells to differentiate to red blood cells.
Which of the following explains how a mutation that removes a portion of each cytoplasmic domain of <math alttext="E P o R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EPoR</mi></math> most likely affects differentiation of the cells?

choices.label: The cells will differentiate more rapidly than they typically do because the <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math> kinases will always be active.

The cells will mature to another cell type because the <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math> kinases will phosphorylate inappropriate cellular proteins.

<math alttext="S T A T 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>STAT</mi><mn>5</mn></math> will not be activated because erythropoietin cannot bind to the <math alttext="E P o R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>EPoR</mi></math>.

<math alttext="S T A T 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>STAT</mi><mn>5</mn></math> will not be activated because it will not be phosphorylated by the <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math> kinases.

content.answer: <math alttext="S T A T 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>STAT</mi><mn>5</mn></math> will not be activated because it will not be phosphorylated by the <math alttext="J A K 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>JAK</mi><mn>2</mn></math> kinases.
